boki-beran.title: Episode 1.9
boki-beran.description: Boki, a web architect at Intuit, talks about standardizing the approach to UI across 14 teams on a 25-year-old product, and a philosophy of building components with their ultimate replacement in mind.

patrick-hamann-seb-cevey.title: Episode 1.8
patrick-hamann-seb-cevey.guest: Patrick Hamann and Seb Cevey, The Guardian
patrick-hamann-seb-cevey.description: Patrick and Seb explain the process of bringing The Guardian's internal and external web applications up to modern standards -- and why the organization believes in doing much of the work in the open.

emily-nakashima.title: Episode 1.7
emily-nakashima.description: Emily shares her story of becoming a developer at Github, the company's approach to front-end performance, and why github.com has a lot less JavaScript on it than you might think.

andrew-betts.title: Episode 1.6
andrew-betts.description: How do you bring some sanity to hundreds of web properties at a 127-year-old company? In this episode, Andrew Betts and I talk about Origami, the answer to that question at the Financial Times.

daniel-eric-lee.title: Episode 1.5
daniel-eric-lee.description: What's it like to take a six-year-old codebase and bring it in line with modern best practices? In this episode, Dan Lee and I talk about how his team at Yammer did just that.

dave-cadwallader.title: Episode 1.4
dave-cadwallader.description: Dave is a software engineering manager on the Core Web team at WalmartLabs. We talk about his path to front-end development, the perils of functional testing, and a framework that his team is working on to help smooth some of those bumps.

daniel-espeset-seth-walker-etsy.title: Episode 1.3
daniel-espeset-seth-walker-etsy.guest: Daniel Espeset and Seth Walker, Etsy
daniel-espeset-seth-walker-etsy.description: Daniel and Seth are on the front-end infrastructure team at Etsy, an offshoot of the performance team. We talk about how their team came to be, and the work they're doing to improve the front-end development story at Etsy.

burak-yigit-kaya.title: Episode 1.2
burak-yigit-kaya.description: Burak, a front-end lead at Disqus, is a third-party JavaScript kindred spirit. In this episode, we talk about the challenges of 3PJS, the importance of the developer experience, and when to stop optimizing for performance.

alex-sexton.title: Episode 1.1
alex-sexton.description: In the inaugural episode of the podcast, I talk to Alex Sexton, my former podcast co-host, a product engineer at Stripe, and the name-er of many things, including Front-End Ops.
